result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber Nekia Lowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample and pay costs and surcharge.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

*Restitution is set at $0.*
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved contact.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
Successfully complete Anger Management, and continued programming.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: Stayed pending a review on 11-13-2015 at 1:15.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Amber Nekia Lowe in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Amber Nekia Lowe in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pursuant to negotiations WHILE ARMED enhancer is deleted.
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.
Defendant sentenced to serve 60 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11-13-2015 at 1:15.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved contact.
-Provide DNA sample and pay costs and surcharge.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution is set at $0.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit,  Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Amber Nekia Lowe in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Upon the request of defense counsel, case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 8-28-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Amber Nekia Lowe in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failed to appear this morning due to a calendaring error. Court admonished defendant.  Court vacates bench warrant.  Case adjourned Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-27-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Charles K., no firearms, make all court dates and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case called at 10:45 am.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to issue.  mld

Defendant Amber Nekia Lowe in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Parties will be exploring a possible deferred prosecution agreement.  Case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 6-2-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Charles K.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Amber Nekia Lowe in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Amber Nekia Lowe in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
